item.title: 柏林敦促科技公司在投票前采取更多措施制止虚假信息
item.description: 德国内政部长周三要求社交媒体平台在下月大选前采取更多措施防止虚假信息，如明确识别政治广告和标注人工智能操纵的视频。【原文：Germany's interior minister told social media platforms on Wednesday to do more to prevent disinformation before next month's election, such as clearly identifying political advertising and labelling videos manipulated with AI.】

item.title: 达沃斯- 纽约证券交易所高层认为 2025 年美国 IPO 活动将十分活跃
item.description: 纽约证券交易所（New York Stock Exchange）的一位高管周三表示，强劲的美国经济和较低的利率可能会促进首次公开募股数量在近期势头的基础上于2025年激增。【原文：A strong U.S. economy and lower interest rates could foster a surge in the number of initial public offerings in 2025, building on the recent momentum, a top executive at the New York Stock Exchange said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮吸引投资者，Meta 支持数据分析公司 Databricks
item.description: Databricks 周三表示，Meta Platforms 已作为投资者参与了一轮 100 亿美元的融资，旨在推动这家数据分析初创公司的扩张计划和新产品开发。【原文：Databricks said on Wednesday Meta Platforms had joined as an investor in a $10 billion funding round intended to fuel the data analytics startup's expansion plans and new product development.】

item.title: 微软 LinkedIn 因披露客户信息以训练人工智能模型而遭起诉
item.description: 微软的 LinkedIn 遭到了高级客户的起诉，他们称这个以商业为重点的社交媒体平台在未经许可的情况下向第三方披露了他们的私人信息，用于训练生成人工智能模型。【原文：Microsoft's LinkedIn has been sued by Premium customers who said the business-focused social media platform disclosed their private messages to third parties without permission to train generative artificial intelligence models.】

item.title: 谷歌赢得英国对俄罗斯广播公司封锁 YouTube 的禁令
item.description: 谷歌周三赢得了伦敦高等法院的一项禁令，该禁令旨在阻止俄罗斯执行针对美国科技巨头关闭谷歌和 YouTube 多个账户的判决。【原文：Google on Wednesday won an injunction from London's High Court to prevent the enforcement of Russian judgments against the U.S. tech giant over the closure of various Google and YouTube accounts.】

item.title: Stellantis 将推进在伊利诺伊州建造新型中型卡车的计划
item.description: 克莱斯勒母公司斯泰兰特周三表示，正在推进在伊利诺伊州贝尔维迪尔建造新型中型皮卡的计划。【原文：Chrysler parent Stellantis said Wednesday it is moving forward with plans to build a new mid-size pickup truck in Belvidere, Illinois.】

item.title: CNBC 报道：高盛首席执行官称中美改善关系很重要
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）首席执行官大卫-所罗门（David Solomon）周三表示，美国和中国这两个世界上最大的经济超级大国必须改善双边关系。【原文：Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon said on Wednesday it was important for the U.S. and China, the world's two largest economic superpowers, to improve their bilateral ties.】

item.title: 先驱报》投资者投票反对 Boaz Weinstein 的改造计划
item.description: 赫尔德投资信托公司（Herald Investment Trust）的股东们周三否决了美国激进投资者萨巴资本（Saba Capital）要求对其董事会进行彻底改革的动议，这对创始人博阿斯-温斯坦（Boaz Weinstein）推动英国 2,690 亿英镑（合 3,330 亿美元）信托业改革的更广泛努力是一个打击。【原文：Shareholders in Herald Investment Trust on Wednesday rejected a campaign by U.S. activist investor Saba Capital to overhaul its board, in a blow to founder Boaz Weinstein's wider push to shake-up the UK's 269 billion pound ($333 billion) trust sector.】

item.title: 尽管特朗普进行了风能审查，葡萄牙 EDP 公司仍对其美国计划充满信心
item.description: EDP 首席执行官表示，EDP 确信其现有的美国陆上项目不会受到特朗普总统风电决策的影响，但这家葡萄牙最大的公用事业公司将在未来几个月内修改其未来业务计划和增长预期。【原文：EDP is confident its existing U.S. onshore projects will not be affected by President Trump's wind power decisions, its CEO said, but Portugal's largest utility company will revise its future business plan and growth expectations in coming months.】

item.title: 裕信银行首席执行官希望德国商业银行计划在 2025 年底前明朗化
item.description: 联合信贷银行首席执行官 Andrea Orcel 希望与德国新政府讨论收购德国商业银行的计划，他告诉德国《金融时报》（FAZ），希望最迟在今年年底能有明确的结果。【原文：UniCredit chief Andrea Orcel wants to discuss a planned takeover of Commerzbank with the new German government and hopes for some clarity at the latest by the end of the year, he told German paper FAZ.】

item.title: 阿迪恩公司高管表示，特朗普执政期间私募股权退出将有所恢复
item.description: 收购公司 Ardian 的执行总裁周三在达沃斯世界经济论坛的一个小组讨论会上说，在唐纳德-特朗普第二任总统任期内，私募股权投资的退出可能会恢复到几年来从未见过的水平。【原文：Private equity exits that had slowed dramatically may recover to levels not seen in several years under Donald Trump's second term as president, the executive president of buyout firm Ardian said on Wednesday on a panel at the World Economic Forum in Davos.】

item.title: 液化天然气出口商 Venture Global 降低美国上市报价
item.description: 液化天然气出口商 Venture Global 周三下调了其在美国首次公开募股的发行价，实际上增加了计划出售的股票数量，目标估值高达 653.3 亿美元。【原文：LNG exporter Venture Global lowered the offer price for its initial public offering in the U.S. on Wednesday, effectively increasing the number of shares it plans to sell and targeting a valuation of as much as $65.33 billion.】

item.title: 德事隆预计 2025 年利润低于预期；IAM 罢工影响第四季度喷气机交付量
item.description: 德事隆（Textron）周三预计 2025 年利润低于预期，此前由于 9 月罢工对其航空部门的影响以及工业部门需求疲软，该公司的季度收入未达预期。【原文：Textron forecast 2025 profit below estimates on Wednesday, after missing quarterly revenue expectations due to the impact of the September strike on its aviation segment and demand softness in its industrial segment.】

item.title: 投资者回报缓慢，私募股权巨头退出更有价值
item.description: Calpine 公司以 164 亿美元的价格出售给 Constellation 能源公司，这将为这家电力生产商的所有者带来一笔丰厚的意外之财，但同时也激起了私募股权界的希望，即类似的巨额出售可能会帮助这个在投资者现金回报方面举步维艰的行业。【原文：Calpine Corp's $16.4 billion sale to Constellation Energy is set to generate a handsome windfall for the power producer's owners, but has also stoked hopes within the private equity world that similar mega-exits may help an industry struggling to return investor cash.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，摩根大通首席执行官戴蒙称赞昔日对手埃隆-马斯克
item.description: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）和特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）曾经是一场旷日持久的法律战中的对手，这位银行家在周三接受 CNBC 采访时表示，他们已经解决了分歧。【原文：JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon and Tesla chief Elon Musk, once adversaries in a prolonged legal battle, have settled their differences, the banker told CNBC in an interview on Wednesday.】

item.title: 安联首席执行官称期待特朗普政府减少罚款 "敲诈 "行为
item.description: 德国保险公司安联（Allianz）首席执行官周三表示，他预计美国总统唐纳德-特朗普执政期间的监管罚款将少于乔-拜登（Joe Biden）执政期间的罚款，他称拜登执政期间的罚款为 "勒索"。【原文：The CEO of German insurer Allianz said on Wednesday that he expected fewer regulatory fines under U.S. President Donald Trump than under Joe Biden's administration, which he called "extortion".】

item.title: 消费贷款机构 Ally Financial 将向 CardWorks 出售信用卡业务
item.description: 消费者贷款公司 Ally Financial 周三表示，已同意将其信用卡业务出售给信贷和支付公司 CardWorks。【原文：Consumer lender Ally Financial has agreed to sell its credit card business to credit and payments firm CardWorks, the companies said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧洲工业股因特朗普推动人工智能投资而反弹
item.description: 施耐德电气（Schneider Electric）和普睿司曼（Prysmian）等欧洲工业股周三大涨，原因是唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）公布了一项新的人工智能（AI）投资计划后，交易商对其美国业务的前景感到温暖。【原文：European industrial stocks such as Schneider Electric and Prysmian surged on Wednesday as traders warmed up to prospects of their U.S. business after Donald Trump unveiled a new artificial intelligence (AI) investment push.】

item.title: 三得利首席执行官在达沃斯表示，日本企业必须为特朗普关税的影响做好准备
item.description: 饮料巨头三得利控股公司（Suntory Holdings）首席执行官周三表示，日本公司仍然看好在美国的投资，但需要为唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）担任总统期间可能出现的供应链冲击做好准备。【原文：Japanese companies remain bullish about investing in the United States but need to prepare for supply chain shocks that could arise during Donald Trump's presidency, the chief executive of drinks giant Suntory Holdings said on Wednesday.】

item.title: Aptiv 将分拆配电系统业务
item.description: Aptiv 周三表示，将把其配电系统（EDS）业务分拆成一家新公司，这使得这家汽车零部件供应商的股价在盘前交易中上涨超过 5%。【原文：Aptiv said on Wednesday it would separate its electrical distribution systems (EDS) business into a new company, sending the shares of the auto parts supplier up more than 5% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 美国需求改善，宝洁公司季度销售额超出预期
item.description: 宝洁公司周三公布的第二季度销售额超出预期，原因是潘婷洗发水生产商努力将不同价位的新版产品推向市场，在美国吸引了更多顾客。【原文：Procter & Gamble beat second-quarter sales estimates on Wednesday, as the Pantene shampoo maker's efforts to bring newer versions of its products to the market across various price tiers attracted more customers in the United States.】

item.title: 雅培预计全年医疗器械销售将实现盈利
item.description: 雅培实验室（Abbott Laboratories）周三预测年度利润与华尔街预期一致，因为该公司预计医疗技术相关程序的增加将促进对其设备（包括血糖监测产品）的需求。【原文：Abbott Laboratories on Wednesday forecast annual profit in line with Wall Street estimates, as it expects elevated medtech-related procedures to boost demand for its devices, including glucose-monitoring products.】

item.title: 保险巨头 Travelers 盈利超出预期，承保能力增强
item.description: 财险公司旅行者周三公布的第四季度利润超出预期，原因是其承保业务的强劲表现缓解了巨灾损失增加带来的打击。【原文：Property and casualty insurer Travelers beat estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, as strength in its underwriting business cushioned a blow from elevated catastrophe losses.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局称，Stellantis 将召回超过 63,000 辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周三表示，克莱斯勒母公司斯特兰蒂斯公司正在美国召回 63082 辆跨界 SUV，原因是动力传输装置问题导致驱动力损失。【原文：Chrysler parent Stellantis is recalling 63,082 crossover SUV's in the United States over concerns of loss of drive power due to a power transfer unit issue, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 通用汽车召回 2,000 多辆雪佛兰 Equinox 电动汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周三表示，由于自适应巡航控制系统存在问题，通用汽车公司将召回约2890辆雪佛兰Equinox电动汽车。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday that General Motors is recalling about 2,890 Chevrolet Equinox EV vehicles due to concerns about their adaptive cruise control.】

item.title: DP World称，如果红海袭击得到遏制，海运价格可能下降20
item.description: DP World 的副首席执行官说，与以色列无关的船只可能会在两周内开始返回红海，并补充说这可能会导致货运价格 "暴跌"。【原文：Ships not linked to Israel could begin returning to the Red Sea in as little as two weeks, DP World's deputy chief executive said, adding that could see freight prices "come crashing down".】

item.title: 经理人杂志称，大众汽车计划在上半年出售 15%的特拉托股份
item.description: 据《经理人》杂志周三援引未具名公司消息人士的话报道，德国大众汽车公司计划在今年上半年出售其在卡车部门 Traton 公司 15%的股份，希望借此筹集约 20 亿欧元（约合 20.9 亿美元）的资金。【原文：Germany's Volkswagen plans to sell 15% of its shares in truck unit Traton in the first half of this year, hoping to raise about 2 billion euros ($2.09 billion), manager magazin reported on Wednesday, citing unnamed company sources.】

item.title: J&J 因抗癌药物销售而实现超预期的季度销售额和利润
item.description: 强生公司（Johnson & Johnson）刚刚完成以 146 亿美元收购神经系统药物制造商 Intra-Cellular 的交易，本周三公布的第四季度销售额和利润均高于华尔街预期，这主要得益于其癌症治疗药物的强劲销售。【原文：Johnson & Johnson , fresh off a $14.6 billion deal to buy neurological drugmaker Intra-Cellular , reported fourth-quarter sales and profit above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, driven by strong sales of its cancer treatments.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称巴西 5 家公司输华大豆因植物检疫原因被暂停发货
item.description: 两位直接了解此事的消息人士周三告诉路透社，由于巴西大豆货物不符合植物检疫要求，全球最大的大豆买家中国已停止接收来自五个实体的巴西大豆货物。【原文：China, the world's biggest soybean buyer, has stopped receiving Brazilian soybean shipments from five entities after cargoes did not meet phytosanitary requirements, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 花旗银行以地缘政治风险为由上调 2025 年平均油价预期
item.description: 由于以俄罗斯和伊朗为中心的地缘政治风险，花旗银行周三上调了2025年的油价展望，但指出下半年油价可能会有所缓和。【原文：Citi on Wednesday raised its oil price outlook for 2025 due to geopolitical risks centred on Russia and Iran, but noted prices were likely to ease through the second half of the year.】
